info.title: D&B Optimizer
info.description: D&B Optimizer is a foundational data service from Dun & Bradstreet that improves the quality of your business data by correctly identifying, cleansing, and inserting firmographic intelligence into records within your Microsoft application environment.

get.description: D&B Identity Resolution uses input criteria to find the best candidates in its extensive database of entities. It uses proprietary algorithms to identify the best matches and returns those matches with detailed information about what criteria was used to find the match.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The product ID provided by D&B that identifies the product to be returned.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version ID (e.g., v1) that identifies the product version to be returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.x-ms-test-value: string used to search for entities
parameters.description: Up to 240 characters used to find the entity by its primary name, tradestyle names, or former names.

parameters.name: streetAddressLine1
parameters.description: Up to 70 characters of the first line of the entity's street address.

parameters.name: streetAddressLine2
parameters.description: Up to 70 characters of the second line of the entity's street address

parameters.name: countryISOAlpha2Code
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code, defined by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) ISO 3166-1 scheme identifying the country of the entity.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Up to 10 characters of the identifier used by the local country's postal authority to identify where the address is located.

parameters.name: addressLocality
parameters.description: 1 to 50 characters that identifies the city, town, township, village, borough, etc. where the entity is located.

parameters.name: addressRegion
parameters.description: The name of the locally governed area that forms part of a centrally governed nation to identify where the address is located.

parameters.name: telephoneNumber
parameters.description: Up to 32 characters of the telephone number--the sequence of digits used for voice communication with the entity. This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: A URL used to identify an entity by its email domain.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: An email address used to identify an entity by its email domain.

parameters.name: registrationNumber
parameters.description: The number assigned by an external body or by D&B that either uniquely identifies or helps to identify an organization.

parameters.name: registrationNumberType
parameters.description: A unique code assigned by D&B to identify the type of registration number.

parameters.name: confidenceLowerLevelThresholdValue
parameters.description: The lowest confidence level for entities returned in the response. Valid values are 1 to 10, if not specified the default of 4 is used.

parameters.name: exclusionCriteria
parameters.description: Provides the ability to exclude entities based on several properties.

duns.description: The D-U-N-S Number is an identification number assigned by D&B that uniquely identifies the entity in accordance with the Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S).

primary_name.description: The single name by which the entity is primarily known or identified.

trade_style.description: The name that the entity trades under for commercial purposes  although its registered  legal name used for contracts and other formal situations may be another name.

address.streetline1.description: The first line of the address where the entity is located.

address.streetline2.description: The second line of the address where the entity is located.

address.city.description: The name of the city, town, township, village, borough, etc. in which this address is located.

address.territory_code.description: The standard code of the locally governed area that forms part of a centrally governed nation to identify where this address is located.

address.territory_name.description: The name of the locally governed area that forms part of a centrally governed nation to identify where this address is located.

address.postal_code.description: An identifier used by the local country Postal Authority to identify where the business is located.

address.isoalpha2code.description: The two-letter country code, defined by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) ISO 3166-1 scheme identifying the country of the business entity.

address.country_name.description: The country code, defined by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) ISO 3166-1 scheme identifying the country of the business entity.

phone.international_code.description: This sequence of digits contains the International Subscriber Dialling (ISD) code.

phone.number.description: A sequence of digits used for voice communication with the entity. This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

primary_sic.description: The code that identifies the business activity in which the entity is engaged.

industrycode.description.description: The description for the corresponding Industry Code.

employees.local.description: The total number of people engaged by the entity to perform its operations. The scope of this employee figure is identified in informationScopeDescription.

employees.global.description: The total number of people engaged by the entity to perform its operations. The scope of this employee figure is identified in informationScopeDescription.

financials.todate.description: The date when the accounting period ended.  If the Reliability Code denotes the figures are projected (future), then this is the date when the accounting period will end.

financials_global.value.description: The monetary value of income received from customers from the sale of the entity's goods and/or services in USD.  This is the gross sales minus any returns, rebates/discounts, allowances for damages or shortages, shipping expenses passed on to the customer.

financials_local.value.description: The monetary value of income received from customers from the sale of the entity's goods and/or services in local currency.  This is the gross sales minus any returns, rebates/discounts, allowances for damages or shortages, shipping expenses passed on to the customer.
financials_local.value.x-ms-summary: Sales Revenue Amount in the local currency

financials_local.currency.description: The local currency code for this entity.

location_types.description: A semi-colon delimited list of Location Types for this entity.

is_headquarters.description: Indicates if the entity is a Headquarters or not.

is_global_ultimate.description: Indicates if the entity is a Global Ultimate or not.

is_domestic_ultimate.description: Indicates if the entity is a Domestic Ultimate or not.

is_parent_headquarters.description: Indicates if the entity is a Parent Headquarters or not.

is_parent.description: Indicates if the entity is a Parent or not.

is_sibling.description: Indicates if the entity is a Sibling or not.

is_division.description: Indicates if the entity is a Division or not.

is_branch_division.description: Indicates if the entity is a Branch Division or not.

is_subsidiary.description: Indicates if the entity is a Subsidiary or not.

is_branch.description: Indicates if the entity is a Branch or not.

is_single_location.description: Indicates if the entity is a Single Location or not.

parent.duns.description: The D-U-N-S number of the parent entity. A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50% of another corporation's capital stock; these owned companies are subsidiaries to the parent entity.

parent.name.description: The business name of the parent entity. A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50% of another corporation's capital stock.

domestic_ultimate.duns.description: The D-U-N-S Number of the highest level parent within a corporate family tree that is domiciled in the same country as the requested entity. A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50% of another corporation's capital stock. A subject may be its own domestic ultimate.

domestic_ultimate.name.description: The name of the highest business in the family tree that is in the same country as the subject.

global_ultimate.duns.description: The D-U-N-S number of the highest level parent within a corporate family tree. A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50% of another corporation's capital stock. A subject may be its own global ultimate.

global_ultimate.name.description: The primary name of the global ultimate business.

entity_type.description: The D&B Code for the corresponding Business Legal Structure

entity_type.description.description: The name of the legal form or structure of the entity as registered with government authorities (e.g., partnership, corporation, private limited company, government department, proprietorship). A unique code assigned by D&B to identify the legal form or structure of the entity as registered with government authorities

match.confidence.description: Confidence codes are based on the detailed MatchGrade Strings™; over 4 million string combinations are mapped to 10 Confidence Codes, allowing for broad categorization of matched records. The higher the number, the higher the confidence that it is an accurate match.

match.profile.description: Match Data Profile (MDP) Codes indicate if and how each component type was matched in the returned candidate.

match.grade.description: MatchGrade Strings provide qualitative assessments between inquiry and reference components. A - Considered the same, B - Some similiarity, F - Considered different, Z - Missing information, cannot make conclusion.

is_delisted.description: Indicator as to the whether or not the entity has asked that their data not be included in D&B's marketing file for prospecting.

operating_status.description: The D&B code for the corresponding Operating Status

operating_status.description.description: The entity's functional state or trading status (e.g., active, out of business). A unique code assigned by D&B to identify the entity's functional state or trading status.

get.summary: Retrieve data on a specific entity
get.description: The Data Products API returns data about a requested DUNS. The data returned is specific to the product requested.

parameters.name: duns
parameters.description: The D-U-N-S Number is an identification number assigned by D&B that uniquely identifies the entity in accordance with the Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S).

parameters.description: The product ID provided by D&B that identifies the product to be returned.
